result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory J. DEUBLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Heroin (2nd or subsequent offense) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or job search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Comply with his ATR treatment that he is currently involved in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory J. DEUBLER

records.addlTxt:
Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 04-06-2015 @ 10:30 a.m. BR-2.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody on probation hold.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 03-24-15 at 2:00 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Information.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 02-18-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess drug paraphernalia, possess THC and possess Schedule I or II narcotics.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
